newsitem.title: TUNISIA: Tunisian expatriates remit more cash from abroad.
newsitem.headline: Tunisian expatriates remit more cash from abroad.

text.p: Remittances by Tunisians living abroad amounted to 307.4 million dinars ($313.6 million) during the first seven months of 1996, up from 291.1 million dinars ($297 million) over the same period last year, Central Bank figures showed.

In addition, they brought in goods, mainly cars and trucks, worth 125.2 million dinars during the first seven months this year, up from 81.7 million dinars over the same period last year, the figures showed.
There are 610,000 Tunisian emigrants living abroad, 75 percent of them in western Europe, mainly in France where they number more than 344,000, official figures said.
Workers' remittances are the second most important source of Tunisia's net incomes in foreign currencies after tourism. ($=0.98 dinar)
